gw.api.webservice.maintenanceTools

Class WorkQueueConfig

  • java.lang.Object
    • gw.api.webservice.maintenanceTools.WorkQueueConfig
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GWRemotable

    public class WorkQueueConfig
extends Object
implements GWRemotable
    Carries information about the distributed worker processes for a distributed workqueue. Used to query and set the worker configuration on a server.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      int BatchSize
      Get the max number of workitems to be checked out when a worker wakes up. (Default = 10)
      int Instances
      Get the number of worker instances configured to run on this server
      long MaxPollInterval
      Get the maximum time in milliseconds that a worker will wait between queries for new workitems. When a worker exhausts the supply of workitems, it will suspend itself and wait for notifications. If no notification is received, it will wake up and check for new workitems every maxPollInterval millis. This acts as a safety mechanism in case notifications are lost in a clustered environment, and guarantees a maximum latency for workitem processing. This parameter should increase with the number of workers configured, to keep the load on the database from growing excessively. (Default = 60000)
      long ThrottleInterval
      Get the current sleep time between workitems

      • Fields inherited from class java.lang.Object

        Class

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      WorkQueueConfig()

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void setBatchSize(int batchSize)
      Set the max number of workitems to be checked out when a worker wakes up. (Default = 10)
      void setInstances(int instances)
      Set the number of worker instances configured to run on this server (Default = 1)
      void setMaxPollInterval(long maxPollInterval)
      Set the maximum time in milliseconds that a worker will wait between queries for new workitems. When a worker exhausts the supply of workitems, it will suspend itself and wait for notifications. If no notification is received, it will wake up and check for new workitems every maxPollInterval millis. This acts as a safety mechanism in case notifications are lost in a clustered environment, and guarantees a maximum latency for workitem processing. This parameter should increase with the number of workers configured, to keep the load on the database from growing excessively. (Default = 60000)
      void setThrottleInterval(long throttleInterval)
      Set the sleep time between workitems. Use 0 to process workitems as rapidly as possible. (Default = 0)

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

When a worker exhausts the supply of workitems, it will suspend itself and wait for notifications. If no notification is received, it will wake up and check for new workitems every maxPollInterval millis. This acts as a safety mechanism in case notifications are lost in a clustered environment, and guarantees a maximum latency for workitem processing. This parameter should increase with the number of workers configured, to keep the load on the database from growing excessively. (Default = 60000)

      • setMaxPollInterval

        void setMaxPollInterval(long maxPollInterval)
        Set the maximum time in milliseconds that a worker will wait between queries for new workitems. When a worker exhausts the supply of workitems, it will suspend itself and wait for notifications. If no notification is received, it will wake up and check for new workitems every maxPollInterval millis. This acts as a safety mechanism in case notifications are lost in a clustered environment, and guarantees a maximum latency for workitem processing. This parameter should increase with the number of workers configured, to keep the load on the database from growing excessively. (Default = 60000)
        Parameters:
        maxPollInterval -
